subject: Writing
title: Nelson Mandela's Courtroom Speech
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Nelson Mandela's Courtroom Speech.

hook.text: Facing a possible death sentence, Nelson Mandela used his trial as a stage to indict apartheid itself.

buildup.text: In 1964, Mandela was charged with sabotage. The Rivonia Trial could have ended with his execution.

discovery.text: Instead of defending himself, he delivered a three-hour speech explaining why apartheid left no choice but resistance.

twist.text: His closing line â€” 'an ideal for which I am prepared to die' â€” turned a trial into a declaration of principle.

climax.text: He was sentenced to life, not death. His speech reached the world and made him a global symbol of justice.

punchline.text: He turned his own trial into the trial of a nation.

quiz.question: What did Mandela do during the Rivonia Trial?
options: Delivered a three-hour speech indicting apartheid
Pleaded not guilty and remained silent
